story.storykicker: Candidates who cleared KCET 2016 successfully will now have to get their documents verified for which the KEA will begin the process from June 03, 2016.
story.storybody:
The Karnataka Common Entrance Test (KCET) 2016 results were declared on May 28, 2016 on the official website.

The candidates, who had successfully cleared the KCET 2016, will now have to undergo second stage of admission, which is document verification.

The Karnataka Examination Authority (KEA), which had successfully conducted the KCET examination across the state, is considering to introduce online verification of documents.

The verification of documents is scheduled to commence from June 03, 2016.

Candidates who intend to take admission will have to attend the counselling. Such candidates will have to attend the interaction session, which would be conducted at all helpline centres.

During the session, the documents of the candidate's will be verified and they shall get the details of entry options, procedure involved in allotment of seats and payment of fee etc.

After successful verification of documents, eligible candidate will get a secret key to register and create a password as per his/her choice for login at online entry portal. Candidate can enter their options online only after their documents have been verified.

About KCET:

The government of Karnataka established the Common Entrance Test (CET) Cell in the year 1994 for conducting the entrance test and determining the eligibility / merit for admission of Karnataka candidates and the ward/s of Jammu & Kashmiri migrants to the first year or first semester of full-time professional courses for government share of seats in Medical, Dental, Indian Systems of Medicine and Homoeopathy, Engineering / Architecture courses, Farm science i.e. B.Sc. (Agriculture), B.Sc. (Sericulture), B.Sc (Horticulture), B.Sc(Forestry), B.Sc. Agri Bio Tech, BHSc.(Home Science), B.Tech (Agri.Engg), B.Tech (Food Technology), B.Tech (Dairy Tech), B.FSc (Fisheries), B.Tech (Food Science &Tech), B.Sc. (Agri. Marketing and Co-Op), B-Pharma, Pharma-D courses.

 

Read: CBSE IIT JEE Advanced 2016: Results to be out on June 12

Read: Telangana TS EAMCET 2: Online registrations commence from June 01
